Title: 100 - Shape Hit Testing
Tip: Use a QuadTree to speed up hit testing.

Summary.What: Hittesting is finding objects under the mouse cursor.
Summary.Why: It is a common task that happens a lot, so it needs to be fast.
Summary.How: The QuadTree is a data structure that divides the page into smaller and smaller spaces. It is a tree, so it is fast to search.

Samples.Tip: Reuse discarded QuadTree nodes; Avoid creating and destroying objects
Samples.Title: Subdivide the page into smaller and smaller spaces
Samples.Description: The tree is dynamic, rebuild after every frame render, save and reuse discarded nodes.

Samples.Title: Hit Test In Action, QuadTree finding objects
Samples.Description: This sample shows how to use a quadtree to speed up hit testing.
